slides.title: COSO Framework
slides.content:
# COSO Internal Control

## Five Components

| Component | Focus |
|-----------|-------|
| Control environment | Foundation |
| Risk assessment | Identification |
| Control activities | Actions |
| Information/communication | Flow |
| Monitoring | Oversight |

## Control Environment

- Tone at the top
- Board oversight
- Organizational structure
- Commitment to competence

## 17 Principles

Principles support each component.

slides.title: Control Activities
slides.content:
# Types of Controls

## By Timing

| Type | When |
|------|------|
| Preventive | Before event |
| Detective | After event |
| Corrective | Fix issues |

## By Nature

| Type | Example |
|------|--------|
| Authorization | Approval limits |
| Segregation | Separate duties |
| Physical | Locked assets |
| Reconciliation | Bank recon |
| IT controls | Access, processing |

## Segregation of Duties

```
Authorization
Custody
Recording
Reconciliation

(Should be separate people)
```

slides.quizQuestion: Controls that stop errors before they occur are called?

slides.title: Risk Assessment
slides.content:
# Risk Identification

## Risk Categories

| Category | Examples |
|----------|----------|
| Strategic | Competition, market |
| Operational | Systems, processes |
| Financial | Currency, interest |
| Compliance | Legal, regulatory |

## Risk Assessment Process

```
1. Identify risks
2. Assess likelihood
3. Assess impact
4. Evaluate controls
5. Determine residual risk
```

## Risk Response

| Response | Action |
|----------|--------|
| Accept | Live with it |
| Avoid | Eliminate |
| Reduce | Controls |
| Transfer | Insurance |

slides.title: Enterprise Risk Management
slides.content:
# COSO ERM

## ERM Components

| Component | Focus |
|-----------|-------|
| Governance | Culture, oversight |
| Strategy | Objectives, appetite |
| Performance | Risk identification |
| Review | Monitor, communicate |
| Information | Reporting |

## Risk Appetite

```
Level of risk organization
is willing to accept
```

## Risk Tolerance

```
Acceptable variation
around objectives
```

## Heat Map

| | Low Impact | High Impact |
|---|------------|-------------|
| High Likelihood | Medium | High |
| Low Likelihood | Low | Medium |

slides.title: SOX Compliance
slides.content:
# Sarbanes-Oxley Act

## Key Sections

| Section | Requirement |
|---------|-------------|
| 302 | CEO/CFO certification |
| 404 | Internal control assessment |
| 906 | Criminal certification |

## Section 404

```
Management must:
1. Assess internal controls
2. Report on effectiveness

Auditor must:
1. Attest to assessment
2. Report on controls
```

## Material Weakness

Deficiency that could result in material misstatement.

## Significant Deficiency

Less severe than material weakness but noteworthy.

slides.title: Fraud Prevention
slides.content:
# Fraud Risk

## Fraud Triangle

```
    Opportunity
       /    \\
      /      \\
Pressure----Rationalization
```

## Types of Fraud

| Type | Example |
|------|--------|
| Asset theft | Stealing inventory |
| Corruption | Bribery |
| Financial statement | Overstating revenue |

## Prevention

| Control | Purpose |
|---------|--------|
| Tone at top | Culture |
| Background checks | Hiring |
| Segregation | Reduce opportunity |
| Hotline | Reporting |

## Detection

- Data analytics
- Internal audit
- Whistleblower reports
